Posts.Content: Thank you everyone , but really it is what it is, isn't it ? We know why I'm going. Just a couple of things. ....If you have lumpecomy and WLE, showing no lymph involvment, how does it get to your bones? Could the breast cancer be the secondary.? My mind is running on overtime,,, Binny.
Posts.Title: Need some help here girls....

Posts.Content: Hi Julie, Well I am doing that right now, going into my 3rd week.!!!!!!!!!!!! I only had my op  January 12, to be honest the boob area  is covered and sun doesn't really get into your armpit. I just think an extra bit of zapping won't hurt, my team all said just go....!!!!! Lets face it that part of the op takes years to settle down, I'm not sure it is ever right again. If you are worried phone your BCN...I am sure all is ok.. Oh well back to the rum and coke, I think all this should be on prescription.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! hugs Binny.xxx
Posts.Title: sunbathing after radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi, Maggie, Yes got the factor 50, always lie in the shade, always wear a Tshirt in the water. What I should have said is relaxing under the brolly, no need for a tan coming back to WINTER, and my first annual check up.!!!!!   Thanks for you kind thoughts, Back to the brolly...... Binnyy.xx
Posts.Title: sunbathing after radiotherapy

Posts.Content: I am besides myself with worry, for the last few months I have really not been feeling so good. I have ever increasing discomfort in my ribs, spine and now my neck. I also am struggling with Tamoxifen.   I'm totally exhausted all day long. I emailed my breast nurse just to keep her up to speed. She agreed Tamoxifen gave me little to know help after inputting stats into Predict Tool but wants me to keep going until Onc. app in Feb. Ok fair enough. BUT shock horror, shes just emailed me DON'T worry but your surgeon wants a full body bone scan. So ... they think it's spread then? Sometime next week, shes going on about injections going home for a few hours , scan takes an hour. I'm not sure I can take much more.  I've not told my family...I  my mum only told me yesterday "Oh your cured, put it all behind you." My op was last January, my whole world again is full of fear and panic. Binny.xx
Posts.Title: Need some help here girls....

Posts.Content: Does anyone know what drugs are stopped for my breast cancer? I also want to ask has anyone got information on Pituritary tumours? I had B/C two years today. October 2014 my sight in right eye started to go. Since then Eye surgeons and Neurologists have tried to find out why. Tomorrow I have my third brain scan. Disgusting time length. Oncologists took me off Tamoxifen as they said this can cause vision loss? So I am out their 6 weeks no Tamoxifen my sight getting worse. I am a fulltime carer for my husband. No mets in my brain but they say the problem lies in the Pituritary Gland probably a tumour. I am besides myself. Binny.xx
Posts.Title: Breast cancer drugs stopped by Mr Cameron

Posts.Content: Hi,  Michele, Saw your post but been struggling with flu.... Wiped me out. I'm not on anastrozole, but tamoxifen and  I take 175mg Thyroxine a day,.both are hormone led. No question the two don't mix.. I spoke to my Consultant Endocrinologist a few weeks ago. He just looked at me, " well you can't live without either of the drugs" was his reply. Not much help really, just getting used to the new life of resting more...It's too dehabilitating to fight.. Take care. Binny.xx
Posts.Title: Anastrozole/Thyroxine

Posts.Content: Hi Nazia, I'm on Tamoxifen and it's baddddddddddddddd. I know it's not me just been on holiday, fish and salads, swimming, walking for 3 weeks. still look like a beached whale... I do tho' have a bar of wholenut lurking in the fridge for bad times.... Hugs Binny. xx
Posts.Title: Weight Gain on Herceptin

Posts.Content: Hi Jackie,   I agree with George and Jackie to a point. Actually out there are employers of small business out there that cant't, and   won't work like that, their profit margins do not allow it. I was diagnosed as you last Christmas, I am the main bread winner,   I am also a carer for my husband. I was self employed so no protection for me. Nearly a year, with all the treatments  I know I could not go back to work. OK they say its not actually the cancer, but the treatments that get you mentally and physically. they are the things that make you ill. So, I knew there was no job  for me ok 10 mins,      crashing in the armchair for a further 30,. Where can I get a job like that.!! So I decided to fight for my life not my survival. I am now a benefits Queen, I have covered my salary and more, you could say I was a busy fool. I had no Idea.....There is help out there, just knowing it. Monday you need to phone Macmillan ask for benefits advisor, be prepared  to give an hour for this. You not claiming for the Cancer but look at what its done to your body your whole soul.. Says she late up and spending an hour while her creakin bones start to move, shot to bits by Tamoxifen. I hope this has given you hope, if you need more info, friend me, glad to help, it's a rocky road with the DWP. Hugs Binny.xx
Posts.Title: Dealing with emotions and going back to work its hard

Posts.Content: Sorry to be thick.????? I am 6 months post op, and only just brave enough to look through all my hospital letters. Love this sight in those lonely times in the middle of the night. Take care all you brave people...... Binny. xxx
Posts.Title: ER Positive... what does the number mean.??

Posts.Content: Ok so two weeks ago I spent 2 days in lovely hospital. Conclusion was after extensive xrays and scans, without doubt the Fast Forward Radiotherapy trial was giving the dreadfull pain in my ribs and breast bone.  Inflamed bones............ It was followed up by a full bone scan, the results for this last week all clear. Today Onc app with consultant, trial nurse, and Macmillan nurse," after a meeting with us all and your breast surgeon we need to do a CT Scan.".???????? We don't think this is radiotherapy damage.! Jesus, am I clear or not whats all this about. The Onc spends 5 mins looking over whats left  of this right boob then on to the good boob for lumps also poking about by then  in my sweaty armpits...!!!!!!!!!!!! Yuk.. , No all is good, everything helaled up well. Really, my lump was found by mammogram far back on the chest wall, I would have been dead before I had ever felt found the lump.!!!!!!!!!!!! So what are you lookin for, bearing in mind I had my first baseline mammogram in November.? Gggggggrrrrrrrrrrr. Anyway whats this damn CT thing all about.? Help. Poor old Binny.xx
Posts.Title: Need more help girls....

Posts.Content: Good  morning, Dreamthief , Happy Valentines you two love birds, any plans for this lovely wet and windy day? Thanks everyone for their support. Im going to email BCN this weekend and run through it all with her. I find it better as I can list and list all my points instead of trying to talk to an ONC who spends his time trying to cut and run...!!!!!!!! Am I allowed a copy of my bone scan? Hugs Binny.xx
Posts.Title: Need more help girls....

Posts.Content: Good Evening,  Dreamthief, having trouble clickin and saving your Glossary etc... Oh well probably my age. How are the chocs and drinky poos going.?? From a very wet and windy south coast. Think I'll join you with a little Vino.... Binny. xx
Posts.Title: Need more help girls....

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, Has any one got any tips, do's and dont's for me. 9 hour flight.. We have pushed the boat out to business tickets, so I can keep my legs elivated.. bought those lovely socks and a supply of asprin, also getting some antibiotics for my "at risk" arm. As I said before it is a special trip 2x 60th birthdays and the Ruby wedding, tho a friend did tell me you get less for murder.!!!!! Hhhmmmm. On a good day today,  tho' so scared of the first annual check coming my way.. Hugs to all Binny. xx
Posts.Title: Long haul travel on Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hhmmm..... Thanks anyway I'm 8 as well, I think thats bad, well it does'nt sound good,  Hoping someone knows Xxxx
Posts.Title: ER Positive... what does the number mean.??

Posts.Content: Hi, Emmsie, In my case I was bought in to Brighton Breast Care Centre, a week after my mammogram, they did new mamograms under huge magnifling lenses. I was then sent for a scan, I l was there joking about it being a bit of nothing. No he said I see this all day everyday this is a cancer before I do the biopsy< for sure. Clunck he took the sample.  then  he says ok ,I'm off on my holidays now , Mongolia..... Good luck.!    you deserve each other I thought................... I had no one with me , my husband hates hospitals was reading his book in the car park having a fag......It was I was told just to re-check............nothing really. I walked out into my new world, Ive got CANCER I shouted out loud, no one heard me, I looked all around me their worlds had'nt changed, people catching buses, walking, talking. Got in the car "well " . he said.........................! Hugs Binny.xx
Posts.Title: Do docs play down cancer until they get biopsy results or can they...

Posts.Content: Hi, I feel the same,how do you know when or what to look for.?? I am now 100% sure there will never be a morning when I wake up, without thinking that. Sorry..... Binny.
Posts.Title: All Done ... So what am I ??

Posts.Content: Hi Maureen.   OH NO my tamoxifen is Wockhardt................. stewing from a Mumbai heat.????? Does anyone know about these or any drugs,all pack info sheets say not to be stored over 25 deg.ish. We have been in the 30's this summer, so are all our packs, and those wilting on pharmacy shelves no damn good. Please does anyone know.? Binny.xx
Posts.Title: Arimidex? Help!

Posts.Content: Hi Ogre, ??? Don't feel lonely, we are all here for you. I too have the thyroid problems with the bloody "C", not helpful is it. Just let it all go no more questions tomorrow is nearly here. let them get on with what they know  best, its all ok, we are all popping out the other side. Love hugs, sleep well. Binny.xx
Posts.Title: Friday the 13th is upon me - feeling lonely

Posts.Content: Hi, Maureen. What I meant was make sure you take all your Levo from the same manufacturer, sometimes they try to palm you off with different makes, not good different packing agents, different side effects. I learnt that to my cost.... Binny.xx
Posts.Title: Arimidex? Help!

Posts.Content: Hi, I  had the same op  and treatment, tho' I am on Tamoxifen for the cancer. My thyroid completely stopped working  in 1996 so am also on Levo. I was taking the the Teva drugs 18 mths ago,which have now been banned, it's taken me 2 years to get back to " normal" if there is ever such a thing,then on top this bloody cancer, and Osteo arthritis because the  Teva drug didn't work. I'm a bloomin mess......!!!!!!!!!! Your symptoms do shout thyroid to me. What Levo are you on and what mg.??? With the Teva I was on 275mg now idling out at 175mg on a drug thats working.!!!! Binny xxx
Posts.Title: Arimidex? Help!

Posts.Content: Go for it girl..... Enjoy...... Binny xx xx  sleep well..
Posts.Title: Seroma

Posts.Content: Hi Rebecca, you are an 8 ..... What does it mean, I guess, never miss a tablet ? Binny  xx
Posts.Title: Finished all treatment but need advice on tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Can u share that on here? So where does that love me 18mths down the line?
Posts.Title: DAIRY FOODS HIT BREAST CANCER RECOVERY

Posts.Content: Hey, I have been reading all your posts about getting through Christmas...... getting back to work...etc. etc. Do you all know what a hell of a year we have all had... Whats happened is we have all lost our fight or flight mechanisim.... Magr I did what you did, put on the Christmas, family 4 grandchildren in and out for 4 days, "oh it's great she's better I could here."   GGGGgrrrrrrrr.   NO I'm a mess............ So Boxing day night I went to bed and I've just got up, the tiredness nearly killed me. I feel better for it, tho',       lost yesterday.!!! Lookin around I have definatly lost my fight for housework.!!!!! Hugs and a Happy New Year to THE Class of 2013. xxxxxxxxxx Binny xx
Posts.Title: Flight or Fight.

Posts.Content: This sounds correct. I read something similar. Very worrying. My article also questioned why girls were ovulating at 8yrs, could it be all the hormones pumped into cattle to fatten them up.  Maybe this includes yoghurts and cheese then? Binny xx
Posts.Title: DAIRY FOODS HIT BREAST CANCER RECOVERY

Posts.Content: Thanx G + J, I like that sort of advice! Going back to my milky coffee. Ready for my nightly glass of fizzy or two! Binny xx
Posts.Title: DAIRY FOODS HIT BREAST CANCER RECOVERY

Posts.Content: Hi Anna. I had the same op as you are going to have and finished Rads in April. I am 59, taking Tamoxifen for 5years, or so I thought. Last week saw Onc. he says things are moving on and they would now be prescribing for 10 years.!!! Binny.xx Hugs
Posts.Title: Just been diagnosed BC

Posts.Content: Ah, Dorothee,  Thanks for all your input this year, to sooooooooooo many of us........ I was thankful when I first joined this site you swept me up and put me right. Ive watched as I progressed through my treatment this year, as you gathered other newbies up in their panic. Also George and Jackie who did the same  to me... God Bless you all for help and kindness> Hugs Binny.xx Kickin  out  2013 where it belongs.
Posts.Title: Bah humbug

Posts.Content: I am 16 months post op. 3 days ago this horrible cording appeared on the underside of my arm. From my lymph scar to the palm of my hand.   Ouchhhhhh. Breast nurse said go to GP today, check for infection, if its cording you will need Physio. Tho' its rare after so long...post op.. Yes well so was Radiotherapy damage where it can crack ribs,  they didn't crack but so inflamed it put me in hospital for a week, this winter. So waiting for Physio appointment. never ending story.... Has anyone had this cording and how can I handle it before the NHS gets me the Physio I so need  it now before it gets worse. Thanks Binny.xx PS. Was trying to wean myself off this site, but I so soooo need my dummy still.  Ha.
Posts.Title: Help Needed.

Posts.Content: Oh Dear, That's just how it is today in this house.................... Loved it. Binny xx
Posts.Title: Saw this and it made me smile

Posts.Content: Hi Tracey, I'll hold your hand if you'll hold mine. I'm running a few weeks after you, I am not sure what to expect. I have appointments running Nov to Feb,    .whats all that about.?? Family and friends just think "what you on about , It's all gone." At the moment if they do the mammogram and send me off I am not sure I'll have it. I am happy to have  it and sit and wait for results. I cannot go through all that again over Christmas. My whole life is just now is reliving everyday of what was happening this time year.... I cannot let them take control of my life and feelings again. The poor girl who was on here earlier told to come back on Tuesday .!!!!!!!!!!! HELLO  why the hell should the nurse know and not her, its about time in certain fields of medicine people started working 24/7, like most of us have to. OK I'll stop spitting now, cos that is what my 3 boys say I do, but it's b....y justified. Binny xxxx Friend me if you want a hand to  hold, I need one...
Posts.Title: FEELING REALLY DEPRESSED

Posts.Content: Hi, This is a very sore point for me...... I was diagnosed last Christmas, I was told the best way forward as a fulltime carer for my husband and being the bread winner and working from home was to explain to our mortgage lender that I wiould not be able to keep up full payments over the next six months, owing to the operation and treatment. To cut a long story short they asked for repossesion after 3 months as I was behind by two months, I got the first letter two days before my surgery, the judge helped out by adjourning the repossesion, they came back  just as I started Radiotherapy and applied again, they agreed to wait until the finish of my treatment. So here we are no recovery time, just spent it packing and finding rented .... To them it was a house, to us our family home where we brought up our 3 boys. I am shattered and sooooooo angry. It gets worse we thought oh treat ourselves to a nice holiday, just before my first annual check up. Travel insurers want £600 for a three week holiday.............. Good luck, I'll fly without.... Binny...
Posts.Title: borrowing money

Posts.Content: Hi, everyone....... Thank you all so much for your kind words, Allme, you have the right idea, time to recover and become one of those benefiit scroungers......... How hard we worked to get what we had ,I just needed time........ our equity stripped away by their loan shark fees. The government are the losers....pay back time.!!!!!!!! The holiday,well we are both 60 this year, Ruby wedding as well, so to hell with it, we are going back to "Our Island In The Sun.", where we had our honeymoon....!!!!!!!! Who needs travel insurance........cant see much harm coming my way from laying on a sun lounger for three weeks.............................................. I will be starting a new discussion, Effects of Flying Long Haul with Tamoxifen.......!!!! Binny....    love and hugs  to all feeling down today.xxx   I
Posts.Title: borrowing money

Posts.Content: Earlier there was a posting from a young medical student doing a survey.   Lots of you posted you did it and good luck. I just did it and went to let her know. Nothing, everyone's posts as far as I can see have been zapped away ???? Sad because, she had some good points to raise, why should we wait so long for results. Am I right or just b....y useless on the computer. Binny.
Posts.Title: What happened.

Posts.Content: Thanks all for that, another part of this site newly discovered.!!!!!!!! Thanks everyone for the replies... Autumn is here.!!!! Keep warm. Binny.xx
Posts.Title: What happened.

Posts.Content: Yes it saved mine. I was due for a mammogram put had to have an op so I put it off for a month. Had the mammogram, 2 days later phone call does'nt match up to 2007 and 2010....OMG.... BUT if  I had gone when I should they think they would not have found it, too small... mammograms must be done yearly.............. Binny xx 3 years is tooooo long for these little blighters..
Posts.Title: mammogram save my life.

Posts.Content: Hi Kat, I was in your position, just over a year ago. How could I wait...... I couldn't, I made an urgent appointment with my GP for the same day, I knew she could tap into the hospital records. She did just that, I was glad  she told me , it was far more personal. It gave me the time to prepare for the ongoing treatment appointment. I just couldn't face that cold room with the surgeon and the token nurse with a box of tissues, and everyone looking as you came out of THE room. Hugs Binny.xx
Posts.Title: hospital called doctor wants to see me. scared

Posts.Content: Thank you Hudson, for popping in to our group....... I have read your profile, bless you. My prayers are with you to give you the strength you so need. Take care. Binny.xx
Posts.Title: I can't cope anymore

Posts.Content: Hi Gail, Sorry for the late reply, I did see your post the other day but I've been bad with a flu type bug... I had this, but mine was a lot to do with where the lymph nodes had been removed, or so I was told. I think it's where they cut and it has interfered with the sweat glands. Once the rads were over and you get back into your old routine with shower and deodorant and of course time to let the whole area recover, it does go away. One thing they did suggest was to lay with a fan after washing and let the area get cool and really dry a few times of day. Hope this is of some help. Binny.xx
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy and underarm is smelling

Posts.Content: Well this is the day, I went this morning to be injected with the radioactive material, now sitting at home drinking buckets of water.... Back at 4pm for the scan. I was spitting at BCN about waiting for results.........how long........crazy can't sleep.... Here we go again, you dam well know the Radiographer is the one who checks these out. Up against all the damn departments closing again for the weekend.. Sorry to moan.....amazing if you are in A & E, they look at your scans etc straight away.. GggggRrrrrrrrrrrr, not a good day. How long is the waiting time, is it a case of letter if ok and a phone call to come in, which means I may go with a gun or do a detour over Beachy Head. , cant do the room with token tissue box again. Hugs Binny.xx
Posts.Title: Bone Scan.

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone,  BCN just phoned it's all clear........... Scan showed lots of inflammation damage to ribs and sternum as result of Fast Forward Radiotherapy trial. Onc Is advising trial nurse and I will see them in 2 weeks. I just wanted to say a big thank you for all your support, it's gonna take a day or two for it too all sink in. I'm having a crafty can of cider............. You all just kept me going. Thanks, Hugs Binny.xx
Posts.Title: Bone Scan.

Posts.Content: Well this is the day, I went this morning to be injected with the radioactive material, now sitting at home drinking buckets of water.... Back at 4pm for the scan. I was spitting at BCN about waiting for results.........how long........crazy can't sleep.... Here we go again, you dam well know the Radiographer is the one who checks these out. Up against all the damn departments closing again for the weekend.. Sorry to moan.....amazing if you are in A & E, they look at your scans etc straight away.. GggggRrrrrrrrrrrr, not a good day. How long is the waiting time, is it a case of letter if ok and a phone call to come in, which means I may go with a gun or do a detour over Beachy Head. , cant do the room with token tissue box again. Hugs Binny.xx
Posts.Title: Bone Scan.

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone,  BCN just phoned it's all clear........... Scan showed lots of inflammation damage to ribs and sternum as result of Fast Forward Radiotherapy trial. Onc Is advising trial nurse and I will see them in 2 weeks. I just wanted to say a big thank you for all your support, it's gonna take a day or two for it too all sink in. I'm having a crafty can of cider............. You all just kept me going. Thanks, Hugs Binny.xx
Posts.Title: Bone Scan.

Posts.Content: Looks amazing........ Binny.xx
Posts.Title: Wig Photo (attempt)

Posts.Content: I to had roughly the same treatment and diagnoses as you. I've finished my course of radiotherapy and am now playing the waiting game again. The first annual check up letters have started to come my way. November to February 2014, with mammograms and scans right on chrismas again , I simply can't do another christmas waiting for results,everything shuts down for 2 weeks. So here I am 4 months to wait . Does anyone know exactly what happens, where and what do they check, other parts of my body? I'm exhausted with the daily worry of what next, what will they find.Can''t sleep............ Sorry to be so negative on your happy mood. Hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: My Good News

Posts.Content: Hi Cathy, Totally agree, but wev'e got girls on here in their 20's with this disease. The age has to be lowered more than 40's, it's stupid then every three years !!  we all know what can happen in 3 years. I think we are the only civilised country where you don't get an annual mammogram and smear. Even my friend from South America gets both early 20's to 70's., they have annual checks for these BP and bloods....that's what you call good medicine.  Nip things in the bud.. Smears stop ay 64, why? People are living longer,( the pension age has gone up.!! )  and enjoying their life as never before.......... Yes we have to do something, they have money to treat health tourists..... I'm 59 and on Tamoxifen so would like to have an annual smear, I was told by GP, I will get one more at 64, there is no money in the budgets...... She suggested I pay privately £140 approx., not sure about paying for the mammogram, but why should we. We need thorough annual check ups. Hugs, Binny.xx fed up, recovering from flu,and it's raining hard.........
Posts.Title: Should we petition for routine mammograms to be offered for over 40...

Posts.Content: Hi,    I'm in Eastbourne......... saw the lovely DGH mentioned, so I'm butting in.... Aroma mum are you near me. Hugs. Binny.xx
Posts.Title: First post

Posts.Content: Hi, I'm so sorry to hear this news. We had a discussion last week if I remember correctly on this site Someone was asking what do I say  I have cancer, I had cancer or what.? I think we all know the answer now. Hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: back again @37
